Zenodo | http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1436630 1.0.1.1 Load packages library(phyloseq) library(microbiome) library(data.table) library(RColorBrewer) library(ggpubr) library(readr) library(picante) library(nlme) library(ggplot2) library(ape) library(vegan) 1.1 Create Phyloseq object Additional reading https://joey711.github.io/phyloseq/ https://joey711.github.io/phyloseq/import-data.html Letâ€™s start with uplaoding the data, 3 files are needed, 1. Biom file 2. Metadata file 3. Tree file, pseq <- read_phyloseq(otu.file= "BiomWorkshop.biom1", taxonomy.file = NULL, metadata.file = "MetaWorkshop.csv", type="biom", sep =";" ) treefile <- read_tree("TreeWorkshop.tree") ps <- merge_phyloseq(pseq, treefile) ps ## phyloseq-class experiment-level object ## otu_table() OTU Table: [ 489 taxa and 28 samples ] ## sample_data() Sample Data: [ 28 samples by 8 sample variables ] ## tax_table() Taxonomy Table: [ 489 taxa by 7 taxonomic ranks ] ## phy_tree() Phylogenetic Tree: [ 489 tips and 488 internal nodes ] ps is a phyloseq object The data we use in this workshop has been publised https://doi.org/10.1186/s42523-019-0009-z ps <- prune_taxa(taxa_sums(ps) > 0, ps) ps ## phyloseq-class experiment-level object ## otu_table() OTU Table: [ 489 taxa and 28 samples ] ## sample_data() Sample Data: [ 28 samples by 8 sample variables ] ## tax_table() Taxonomy Table: [ 489 taxa by 7 taxonomic ranks ] ## phy_tree() Phylogenetic Tree: [ 489 tips and 488 internal nodes ]
